diablo2015

Class Robot

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase
      • diablo2015.Robot

  • public class Robot
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase
    Our 2015 Recycle Rush Robot. This class represents our Robot and all of the physical mechanisms that go on it. This class extends SampleRobot, provided by FIRST. There should reasonably only be one instance of this class per session.
    Author:
    Erich Maas

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  Robot.Mode
      An enum that holds the different possible modes the Robot may be in.

    • Field Detail

      • TICK_PERIOD

        public static final long TICK_PERIOD
        The amount of time, in milliseconds, between each successive periodic 'tick'. A 'tick' is a call of the tick() method of every Tickable object in the set maintained internally by the Robot class.

        This constant allows us to change the resolution of the periodic updates provided to various classes. A finer resolution, i.e., a lower TICK_PERIOD, is more resource intensive, but is more responsive.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • robotDrive

        edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotDrive robotDrive
        This field represents the drive-train of the Robot, and controls its main wheels. It is initialized during the constructor with all of the speed controllers that control the wheels of the drive-train.

      • dualstick

        DualStickController dualstick
        The dual-stick controller which we use to drive our robot. As of 2015, this controller is the DualShock Logitech controller.

      • joy

        edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick joy
        Limit switch at bottom left of elevator.

      • currentControl

        private Tickable currentControl
        The current object that controls the robot. It should be an instance of Autonomous or Teleop (or null if disabled), usually.

      • mode

        private Robot.Mode mode
        The current mode of the Robot. This can be any of the values in the Robot.Mode enum. Currently, those are Autonomous, Disabled, and Teleoperated. This is updated once every tick.

      • tickables

        private final java.util.HashSet<Tickable> tickables
        A set of objects to be periodically ticked.

        public Robot()
        Construct a new Robot. This initializes all of the hardware on the Robot.

      • addTickable

        public void addTickable(Tickable tickable)
        Adds a Tickable object to the list of Tickable objects. These objects' tick methods will be, synchronously, and in no particular order, invoked periodically, with a TICK_PERIOD millisecond gap in between each iteration.
        Parameters:
        tickable - the object that should be added to the set

      • removeTickable

        public void removeTickable(Tickable tickable)
        Removes a Tickable object from the list of Tickable objects.
        Parameters:
        tickable - the object to remove
